visage 0.0.0.9006
  • Reference

Generating random values from the expression

Source: R/zzz_CLOSED_FORM.R
CLOSED_FORM-cash-gen.Rd

This function generates random values from the expression. Random values will be generated independently as long as they don't share the same symbol in the expression.

Arguments

n

Integer. Number of observations.

rhs_val

Boolean. Whether or not to keep the right hand side values of the expression.

Value

Numeric values.

Examples


# Constant variable
a <- 1

# Random uniform variable
b <- RAND_UNIFORM$instantiation()

# Define a closed form expression
cf <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~3 * (exp(a) + b))

# Generate 5 values
cf$gen(5)
#> [1]  9.132997  8.360757  8.249943  9.119460 11.105677

# Generate 5 values, and keep RHS
cf$gen(5, rhs_val = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 10.923268  9.687021  9.385026  9.415514  9.080337
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$b
#> [1] 0.9228074 0.5107250 0.4100603 0.4202229 0.3084970
#> 
#> 

d <- RAND_NORMAL$instantiation()

# Define a closed form expression with another closed form expression
cf2 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf + 3 * d)

# Generate 5 values
cf2$gen(5)
#> [1]  9.278894  7.361697  2.020514 13.857710 10.289820

# Generate 5 values, and keep RHS
cf2$gen(5, rhs_val = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] 11.946007 11.220423  7.974983 16.389219  7.841638
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$b
#> [1] 0.9169064 0.1377755 0.4454593 0.7562793 0.4114016
#> 
#> $rhs$cf
#> [1] 10.905565  8.568172  9.491223 10.423683  9.389050
#> 
#> $rhs$d
#> [1]  0.3468140  0.8840836 -0.5054136  1.9885120 -0.5158043
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two random variables of the same name
cf3 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~d + d)

# Both `d` will share the same values
cf3$gen(5, rhs_val = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] -0.6500048  0.5684983  0.7243094  1.2078874 -0.9101950
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$d
#> [1] -0.3250024  0.2842492  0.3621547  0.6039437 -0.4550975
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two closed form expressions of the same name
cf4 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf3 + cf3)

# Both `cf3` will share the same values, both `d` will share the same values as well
cf4$gen(5, rhs_val = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1]  0.1693139 -0.4139042  0.3774017  6.3133598 -6.6664645
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$d
#> [1]  0.04232847 -0.10347605  0.09435042  1.57833994 -1.66661613
#> 
#> $rhs$cf3
#> [1]  0.08465693 -0.20695209  0.18870083  3.15667988 -3.33323226
#> 
#> 

# Define a closed form expression with two different closed form expressions,
# but contains same random variables
cf5 <- CLOSED_FORM$instantiation(~cf3 + cf4)

# Both `d` in `cf3` and `cf4` will share the same value
cf5$gen(5, rhs_val = TRUE)
#> $lhs
#> [1] -13.190082  -5.752520  -1.752577   5.182933   4.269874
#> 
#> $rhs
#> $rhs$d
#> [1] -2.1983469 -0.9587533 -0.2920961  0.8638222  0.7116456
#> 
#> $rhs$cf3
#> [1] -4.3966938 -1.9175066 -0.5841923  1.7276444  1.4232913
#> 
#> $rhs$cf4
#> [1] -8.793388 -3.835013 -1.168385  3.455289  2.846583
#> 
#>
